newsitem.title: USA: Eagle Financial Corp Q4 shr loss vs profit.
newsitem.headline: Eagle Financial Corp Q4 shr loss vs profit.

text.p: (All data above 000s except per share numbers)
NOTE - 1996 net both periods includes a one-time, pre-tax charge of $4.7 million related to the assessment to recapitalize the Savings Association Insurance Fund.

1996 year net includes a $15.9 million gain for the purchase of five branch offices in Hartford and the simultaneous closings of two nearby branches; a $2.9 million restructuring charge related to the investment and loan portfolios; and additional charges of about $1.5 million including a special marketing promotion to increase the bank's visibility in Hartford and for one-time consulting charges.
Total assets at September 30, 1996, were $1.39 billion vs $1.24 billion at September 30, 1995.
Net loans receivable at September 30, 1996, were $814 million vs $714 million as of September 30, 1995.
Net deposits at September 30, 1996, were $1.06 billion vs $952 million.
